hook.text: African farmers developed a technique that repels one pest and attracts another's predator simultaneously.

buildup.text: Stem borers devastate corn across Africa. Striga weed parasitizes corn roots. Both attack at once.

discovery.text: Planting Desmodium between corn rows 'pushes' stem borers away with repellent chemicals.

twist.text: Desmodium also suppresses Striga by disrupting its chemical signals. One companion plant solves two unrelated problems.

climax.text: Push-pull farming increased yields by 200% for smallholdersâ€”without any purchased pesticides or fertilizers.

punchline.text: Two companion plants solved Africa's two worst crop pests.

quiz.question: What does the 'push' component of push-pull farming do?
options: Desmodium repels stem borers away from corn with chemical signals
Napier grass pushes corn to grow taller for better sun access
Corn stalks push wind away from fragile Desmodium plants
